tit.e: Ofuregaki Shusei (The collection of laws and regulations compiled by the shogunate)
tit.cmt: 表記、補足を変更しました。

sen.j: 御触書集成（おふれがきしゅうせい）とは、江戸幕府が出した御触書をまとめた法令集のこと。
sen.e: Ofuregaki-shusei indicates a statute book where regulations issued by the Edo bakufu were collected.
Ofuregaki-shusei indicates a statute book where regulations issued by the Edo bakufu were collected.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Ofuregaki shusei indicates a collection of laws and regulations issued by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせ、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 江戸時代を通じて4回に渡って作成された。
sen.e: Generated four times throughout the Edo period.
It was compiled on four occasions during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 元の訳は少し直訳調なので修正しました。
sen.e: It was compiled on four occasions during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただし、当時は正式な呼称は無く、『御触書集成』の名称は、昭和9年（1934年）に岩波書店から刊行した際に編纂にあたった石井良助・高柳真三らが命名した。
sen.e: However, there was no official name of the documents originally, and the name of "Ofuregaki-shusei" was given by Ryosuke ISHII and Shinzo TAKAYANAGI when they published the documents in 1934 from Iwanami Shoten (a publisher).

However, at that time there was no official name for the collection of documents, and the name "Ofuregaki-shusei" was given by Ryosuke ISHII and Shinzo TAKAYANAGI when they published the documents in 1934 from Iwanami Shoten (a publisher).
sen.cmt: I thought it necessary to make reference to the fact that the documents were a compilation.
sen.e: However, at that time there was no official name for the collection, and the name "Ofuregaki-shusei" was given by Ryosuke ISHII and Shinzo TAKAYANAGI when they published the documents in 1934 from Iwanami Shoten (a publisher).
sen.cmt: 用語を変更しました。

sen.j: 寛保2年（1742年）7月に老中松平乗邑が、大目付・目付・表右筆組頭に対して江戸幕府創設以来の御触書の書抜の評定所御定書御用掛（公事方御定書の編纂実務機関）への提出を求めたことに由来する。
sen.e: In July of 1742 (in the old calendar), Norisato Matsudaira ordered Ometsuke (chief inspector of the Edo shogunate), Metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers), and Omote-yuhitsu-kumikashira (chief amanuenses) to submit excerpts of the regulations issued by the bakufu since the Edo bakufu was established, to the office concerned with regulations in Hyojosho (conference chamber) (the actual organization to compile regulations to be issued by the bakufu), and this was the first step for collecting the documents concerned.

This arose from the fact that in July 1742 (in the old calendar), Norisato Matsudaira ordered Ometsuke (chief inspector of the Edo shogunate), Metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers), and Omote-yuhitsu-kumikashira (chief secretary) to submit excerpts of the regulations issued by the bakufu since the Edo bakufu was established, to the office concerned with regulations in Hyojosho, a conference chamber and organization actually responsible for compiling regulations issued by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 「amanuenses」ってつじませんと判断して、「たことに由来する」をarose from the factに変えました。
sen.e: It originated from the fact, in August 1742, Norisato MATSUDAIRA ordered Ometsuke (chief inspector of the Tokugawa shogunate), Metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers), and Omote-yuhitsu kumigashira (chief of the external secretariat) to submit excerpts of ofuregaki (laws and regulations) since the foundation of the Edo bakufu to Hyojosho Osadamegaki Goyogakari (the office actually editing Kujigata-osadamegaki [the law of Edo bakufu]).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にし、表現を変えました。

sen.j: これを受けて幕府の法制度が整備された慶長20年（1615年）以後、寛保3年（1743年）までの129年間に出された御条目・高札・御触書のうち3550通を主題ごとに分類・整理を行った上で、延享元年（1744年）11月に完成、翌年一部が校訂された。
sen.e: Then 3550 articles, notices on boards or orders issued for 129 years from 1615, when the law system of the bakufu was established, to 1743, were sorted and arranged on a theme basis, and the collection was completed in November, 1744, (in the old calendar), and some documents in the collection were revised in the next year.

Some 3550 articles, notices on boards and orders issued over the 129 years from 1615, when the law system of the bakufu was established, to 1743, were sorted and catalogued by subject, and the collection was completed in November, 1744 (in the old calendar), and some documents in the collection were revised in the next year.
sen.cmt: 内容を修正しました。
sen.e: In response to this, 3,550 articles of ojomoku (itemized codes), takafuda (notices on boards), and ofuregaki issued over the 129 years from 1615, when the law system of the bakufu was established, to 1743, were sorted and catalogued by subject to be complied in December 1744, and revised partially in the following year.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し表現を変えました。

sen.j: 続いて宝暦10年（1760年）には延享元年から宝暦10年までの17年分2060通に対して同様の整理が行われた。
sen.e: Then in 1760, 2060 such documents for 17 years up to 1760 from 1744 were sorted out as well.
Later in 1760, some 2060 documents for the 17 years from 1744 up to 1760 were also catalogued.
sen.cmt: この｢整理」に対してcatalogueの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: Later in 1760, some 2,060 documents for the 17 years from 1744 up to 1760 were also catalogued in the same manner.
sen.cmt: 用語を変更しました。

sen.j: これらは提出先が評定所内に設置された御定書御用掛あてに提出されており、また完成した集成は御用部屋と評定所に1部ずつ備え付けられていた。
sen.e: These documents were submitted to the office in charge of regulations of the bakufu within Hyojosho, and one complete such collection was provided in the office and in Hyojosho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These documents were submitted to the office in charge of regulations of the bakufu within Hyojosho, and one complete collection was provided in the office and in Hyojosho.
sen.cmt: suchは必要ではありません。逆にいれると少し特許っぽくなります。
sen.e: These documents were submitted to the Osadamegaki Goyogakari in Hyojosho (conference chamber), and one complete collection was provided in the office and in Hyojosho.
sen.cmt: 用語を変更しました。

sen.j: このことから、公事方御定書の補完的な役割を持っていたと考えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that the collection was used complementarily for compiling regulations by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that the collection was used complementarily for compiling regulations by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that the collection was used complementarily for compiling the Kujigata-osadamegaki.
sen.cmt: 用語を変更しました。

sen.j: その後、天明7年（1787年）に宝暦11年（1761年）から天明7年までの27年分3020通、天保12年（1841年）には天明8年（1788年）から天保8年（1837年）までの50年間6607通が追加された。
sen.e: After that, in 1787, 3020 such documents for 27 years from 1761 to 1787 were added, and in 1841, 6607 such ones for 50 years from 1788 to 1837 were added.
After that, in 1787, 3020 such documents for the 27 years from 1761 to 1787 were added, and in 1841, some 6607 more were added for the 50 years from 1788 to 1837.
sen.cmt: 必要な修正は赤した処にあります。
sen.e: After that, in 1787, 3,020 articles for the 27 years from 1761 to 1787 were added, and in 1841, some 6,607 more were added for the 50 years from 1788 to 1837.
sen.cmt: 表記を変えました。

sen.j: 更に安政元年（1854年）には天保9年（1838年）以後の分の編纂が行われたが、未完に終わった。
sen.e: Furthermore, in 1854, efforts to edit documents concerned in and after 1838 were made, but ended without being completed.
Further, in 1854, efforts to edit documents after 1838 were made, but ended without being completed.
sen.cmt: 「concerned」は原文にあｒちません。
sen.e: Further, in 1854, efforts to edit documents after 1838 were made, but ended without being completed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 以上の3回はいずれも新征夷大将軍の御代始を期に行われており、御代始の新政に合わせて編纂が行われたと考えられている。
sen.e: Each of the collection works was done when new Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who was to subdue the barbarians") started its reign, and it is considered that the editing work was conducted at the timing when a new reign started.

Each of the collections were made when the new Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who was to subdue the barbarians") started his reign, and it is thought that the editing work was conducted to in line with the new reign began.
sen.cmt: 結びつく.が間違っている(poor word collocation)
sen.e: These three collections were made when the new Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who was to subdue the barbarians") started his reign, and it is thought that the editing work was conducted to in line with the new reign began.
sen.cmt: 用語を変更しました。

sen.j: その後、前述のように『御触書集成』と呼ばれ、4回の編纂部分を編纂開始の年代ごとに「寛保集成」「宝暦集成」「天明集成」「天保集成」と呼称された。
sen.e: Later, the entire collections have become to be called "Ofuregaki-shusei," and each of the four edited portions was called "Kanpo-collection," "Horeki-collection," and "Tenpo-collection," respectively.

Later, the entire collections came to be called "Ofuregaki-shusei," and each of the four edited portions was known as the "Kanpo-collection," "Horeki-collection," "Tenmei-collection" and "Tenpo-collection," respectively.
sen.cmt: 時制の間違いがありました。
sen.e: Later, as mentioned previously, the entire collections came to be called "Ofuregaki shusei," and each of the four edited portions was known as the "Kanpo shusei" (collection in Kanpo era), "Horeki shusei" (collection in Horeki era), "Tenmei shusei" (collection in Tenmei era) and "Tenpo shusei" (collection in Tenpo era), respectively, according to the period when the compilation started.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「編纂開始の年代ごとに」を補足し、用語を変更しました。

sen.j: なお、戦後になって石井良助・服藤弘司らによって天保9年以後の法令収集が行われた『幕末御触書集成』が刊行されている。
sen.e: By the way, after the war, Ryosuke ISHII and Koji FUKUFUJI collected the laws and regulations issued in 1838 and later and published "Bakumatsu Ofuregaki-shusei" (Ofuregaki-shusei in the era towards the end of the bakufu).
sen.cmt: 服藤弘司： 正しい読み方、不明です。
sen.e: After the war, Ryosuke ISHII and Koji FUKUFUJI collected the laws and regulations issued in 1838 and later published "Bakumatsu Ofuregaki-shusei" (Ofuregaki-shusei in the era towards the end of the bakufu).
sen.cmt: 「By the way」は友達に手紙を書くような表現。「なお」をincidentallyで訳す手もありますが、場合によって、一つずつの言葉を訳す必要はありませんと言われます。
sen.e: After the war, Ryosuke ISHII and Koji FUKUFUJI collected the laws and regulations issued in 1838 and later published "Bakumatsu Ofuregaki shusei" (Ofuregaki shusei in the end of the Edo bakufu).
